text: Okay please do something about this! It's so unfair that people are being mistreated for being poor and not able to afford Skylight. Also, once Skylight fills up what is going to happen? Please talk to them about subsidies and expanding the hotel offerings. Thank you this is so important to ensure Ethiopians have humane treatment.

text: Also something to stress is that they are making people share rooms and bathrooms if they are in the high school. This means that if one of these people has COVID they will pass it onto others(some who may even be high risk!). It also defeats the purpose of the quarantine as some people might get infected on a later day(like 3,4,5 etc) of quarantine from another person and still be infectious when they are released. So while it may require mobilizing financial resources (and the gov spending money), if you guys have any contacts/ leverage, please bring this issue to light.

text:
<@U010DGZG9DK> looks good, i had something similar started but focused on simple self assessment with the aim being reducing the need to go to hospitals for testing.
From what I understand there is no simple set of Yes/No questions provided by MOH, so the setup might have to change. You can use any aspect of the codebase if you need it, particularly the multi-language support bit for simple addition of langauge. Let me know if you want any more detail.

<https://github.com/intrepid-ab/SelfAsssessmentCovidET.git>

Please note that I only spent few hours on this so it needs a lot of polish.
Let me know what you think.

text:
Hi, I came across <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BoDwXwZXsDI&list=WL&index=3> which introduced to how the Czechs reached a point were it become compulsory  *to wear something covering a part of your mouth and nose when leaving your residence*.  Links from the video description <https://tiny.cc/masks4all> (Czech story) and,  <http://tiny.cc/maskswork> (research papers and summaries on the benefits of masks)

I understand we would want the little masks we have to be available for the health professionals, as such asking the population to refrain from using masks is a valid request. Then the question is can we do what the Czechs did? I doubt we will be able to, because we might not have enough tools and input materials for making it happen. Even if we did, it might take weeks to reach the level of production that is helpful, or we might want these masks to be first available to the individuals at high risk of contracting the virus and who's services are of utmost importance , for example,  Health Extension Workers, firefighters, police officers and other service providers. I am not saying it is impossible just the cost in time might be too high.

But, I think we have one cultural advantage, Natela (ነጠላ). The advantage I see are,
1. significant number of the population have it. Thus, financial cost will not be a hindrance for most,
2. adaptation of its use can be achieved rapidly. Thus, it doesn't have much cost in time,
3. Similar communication as used by the Czechs government can be used *"covering a part of your mouth and nose when leaving your residence"* instead of "wear masks". Thus, it doesn't conflict with existing messaging of not using masks unless you are sick.

A possible disadvantage of using Natela (ነጠላ) is its various form factors. Describing how many time to fold before wearing might differ depending on the different thicknesses. But I am not a marketer, or professional health communicator, so it might not be a big issue.

What do you think?

attachments.title: We need #masks4all

attachments.title: OVERVIEW: Czech campaign #masks4all
attachments.text: During the COVID-19 crisis, the Czech Republic has experienced shortages of protective equipment (masks and respirators). What little was available was saved for the most vulnerable workers - doctors, nurses, social workers etc. On March 14 (two weeks since the first confirmed case), a speaker, ...

attachments.text: Papers about effectiveness of basic masks The papers below have been used to create a video summarizing the utility of basic masks. In summary: everyone should wear masks, which they should make themselves using t-shirts or paper towels, whenever they go out in public. Here’s the video. I’ve also...

BTW the GIT you sent is not accessible.

text:
Hi everyone, I have taken a look at the projects in GitHub and I can see a few in there. Can someone help me answer the following questions please

1. There are 14 repos - what is the plan for each of these? The README's provide good technical info but don't state the purpose of the project
2. What are the priorities? I can see myself contributing to 1 or 2 of these projects so would be good to know which one we need to get into production asap
3. Is the plan to deploy all of the projects collectively under the name of MoH?

Sorry if these questions have been answered already I haven't been able to join the calls as it clashes with work.

text:
------
I should have been a bit clear with what my thinking/motivation was
• We don't want to take long creating an app to only address very limited number of users with the traction we will get from it.
• We can rely on the MOH questions that are not personal to guide users into decision to get to a resource (call vs stay home vs self isolate)
• Data collection, Data security, Network security, comm with MOH DB access for test and prod will take forever imo. Hence why I was limiting this to just user actions.
• Also note that new apps are now taking roughly 7 days before approval adding more to the time requirements. 
-----
Now, if we want to go down the route of getting user data access, with the bells and whistles, we can. It is doable, but needs more time and resource. Flutter may not cut it for this, might have to go native...adding to the complexity.

I am fine doing either of them, happy to focus the weekend on this.

elements.text:
------
I should have been a bit clear with what my thinking/motivation was
We don't want to take long creating an app to only address very limited number of users with the traction we will get from it.
We can rely on the MOH questions that are not personal to guide users into decision to get to a resource (call vs stay home vs self isolate)
Data collection, Data security, Network security, comm with MOH DB access for test and prod will take forever imo. Hence why I was limiting this to just user actions.
Also note that new apps are now taking roughly 7 days before approval adding more to the time requirements.

-----
Now, if we want to go down the route of getting user data access, with the bells and whistles, we can. It is doable, but needs more time and resource. Flutter may not cut it for this, might have to go native...adding to the complexity.

I am fine doing either of them, happy to focus the weekend on this.

text: <@U010JMN7DNJ> I agree it will not be an easy road doing it with MoH but I'm afraid that is the only way to get the tractions need for the app and for it to be of purpose. We can make another self assessment app but I'm sure there are tons already out. <https://covid.joinzoe.com|https://covid.joinzoe.com> is similar initiative by NHS in the UK and collected millions of users data already. If MoH put it's resources I don't see any reason why it won't reach that kind of traction. I think all hands call has started we can do a zoom afterwards or brainstorm on it on the weekend if something can come out of it.

attachments.title: COVID Symptom Tracker
attachments.text: COVID Symptom tracker lets anyone healthy or with symptoms share valuable information with researchers and the NHS. Just take 1-minute to self-report daily, even if you are well, to help identify (a) How fast the virus is spreading in your area (b) High-risk areas (c) Who is most at risk, by better understanding symptoms linked to underlying health conditions.

text: <!here> I don’t speak Amharic, but I’m hearing from people in our neighborhood and educated people throughout Addis, celebrating this Ministry of Innovation & Technology release saying they finished testing and are in mass production on some immunity boosting “medicine.” I can’t understate how deflating this is. People are out meeting friends and neighbors because they think Covid-19 has been cured. While we isolate ourselves in our home, our helper just came back from celebrating with neighbors. People aren’t listening to reason that there are only 16 known cases here and none are cured so clearly there is no evidence of this. While so many I know are working tirelessly to try to communicate the need for social distancing, not sleeping due to our efforts, and we sit on our hands waiting for approvals, government agencies are communicating false messages giving false hope and sending people into each other’s arms to spread the virus? I don’t mean to stir up the pot. Maybe this was discussed on the call I missed, but it seems to me this changes the entire direction of this group and the urgency of the need for accurate public messaging.

elements.text: I don’t speak Amharic, but I’m hearing from people in our neighborhood and educated people throughout Addis, celebrating this Ministry of Innovation & Technology release saying they finished testing and are in mass production on some immunity boosting “medicine.” I can’t understate how deflating this is. People are out meeting friends and neighbors because they think Covid-19 has been cured. While we isolate ourselves in our home, our helper just came back from celebrating with neighbors. People aren’t listening to reason that there are only 16 known cases here and none are cured so clearly there is no evidence of this. While so many I know are working tirelessly to try to communicate the need for social distancing, not sleeping due to our efforts, and we sit on our hands waiting for approvals, government agencies are communicating false messages giving false hope and sending people into each other’s arms to spread the virus? I don’t mean to stir up the pot. Maybe this was discussed on the call I missed, but it seems to me this changes the entire direction of this group and the urgency of the need for accurate public messaging.

text:
Let’s assume it does work, Ethiopia still absolutely needs to drive down Rzero enough to allow time for deployment of this med.  

Everyone should be aware of the track record of promising new drugs that did not work under actual  field conditions 

Hope for the best, but plan and TAKE ACTION to mitigate the worst

text:
The current frontline anti-malarial has Trad Med roots, but raising people hopes to the degree that they change their behavior has just lost us a few days.  All the more reason to work even harder on what we are all trying to do.

Time for a viral campaign, let’s not keep our eye off the social distancing ball ?

Time for a viral campaign, let’s not keep our eye off the social distancing ball ?
